content: It appears that confidence in the stimulus plan is being reflected in the pink slips ... quote: Title: Jobless Rate Jumps to 8.5 Percent, 663K Jobs Lost The nation's unemployment rate jumped to 8.5 percent in March, the highest since late 1983, as a wide swath of employers eliminated 663,000 jobs. It's fresh evidence of the toll the recession has inflicted on America's workers, and economists say there's no relief in sight. If part-time and discouraged workers are factored in, the unemployment rate would have been 15.6 percent in March, the highest on records dating to 1994, according to Labor Department data released Friday. The average work week in March dropped to 33.2 hours, a new record low. "It's an ugly report and April is going to be equally as bad," predicted Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody's Economy.com. . . Looking forward, economists expect monthly job losses continuing for most -- if not all of -- this year. <more> "http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2009/04/03/jobless-rate-jumps-percent-k-jobs-lost/"
quote: Title: Jobless Rate Jumps to 8.5 Percent, 663K Jobs Lost The nation's unemployment rate jumped to 8.5 percent in March, the highest since late 1983, as a wide swath of employers eliminated 663,000 jobs. It's fresh evidence of the toll the recession has inflicted on America's workers, and economists say there's no relief in sight. If part-time and discouraged workers are factored in, the unemployment rate would have been 15.6 percent in March, the highest on records dating to 1994, according to Labor Department data released Friday. The average work week in March dropped to 33.2 hours, a new record low. "It's an ugly report and April is going to be equally as bad," predicted Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody's Economy.com. . . Looking forward, economists expect monthly job losses continuing for most -- if not all of -- this year. <more> "http://www.foxnews.com/politics/2009/04/03/jobless-rate-jumps-percent-k-jobs-lost/"
reply: It appears that confidence in the stimulus plan is being reflected in the pink slips ...

content: quote: You are aware that most many of the stimulus provisions don't take effect for a long time, right? As amended, yep! That's one of the (many) reasons the stimulus bill is ... bogus. "Long time" is not the way Obama and Democratic Congress sold the bill. You, of course, are undoubtedly aware that the purpose of the bill was (originally) to create 3.5 million new jobs ... amended (in a CYA move) to preserve and create 3.5 million jobs. I'd suggest that you at least wait until unemployment mirrors what it was on the date that the stimulus bill was passed before bumping this thread.
quote: You are aware that most many of the stimulus provisions don't take effect for a long time, right?

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: If the reps had not pushed the policy of allowing all our jobs to be shipped overseas, we would be in a different position now wouldn't we? Had W not started the BailOut Bananza Boom to start, that can of worms would have never been opened. Thanks "Conservatives"! You're perfectly correct about Clinton and the WTO and NAFTA - But you should also remember that the majority of Democrats voted AGAINST these agreements, and they only passed because almost all Republicans supported them. Now we have Obama as President and he made "noises" about "reforming" Nafta. Which ain't going to happen, because he's not a real Liberal any more than Clinton was. Dave NAFTA Vote in the House of Representatives: Democrats: 102 AYES to 156 NOES Republicans: 132 AYES to 43 NOES Passed 234 to 200. 18 More Democrats or Republicans vote No and it doesn't pass. Nancy Pelosi voted AYE, by the way. NAFTA Vote in the Senate: Democrats 27 YEAs to 28 NAYs, pretty even split Republicans 34 YEAs to 10 NAYs, major majority Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman WTO Vote in the House: Democrats: 167 YEAs to 89 NAYs, 65% voted YEA Republican: 121 YEAs to 56 NAYs, 77% voted YEA Pelosi voted YEA on this too. WTO Vote in Senate: Democrats: 41 YEAs to 14 NAYs, 74.5% voted YEA Republicans: 35 YEAs to 10 NAYs, 77.8% voted YEA Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman As you can see both parties are to blame for NAFTA and the WTO.

You're perfectly correct about Clinton and the WTO and NAFTA - But you should also remember that the majority of Democrats voted AGAINST these agreements, and they only passed because almost all Republicans supported them. Now we have Obama as President and he made "noises" about "reforming" Nafta. Which ain't going to happen, because he's not a real Liberal any more than Clinton was. Dave
reply: NAFTA Vote in the House of Representatives: Democrats: 102 AYES to 156 NOES Republicans: 132 AYES to 43 NOES Passed 234 to 200. 18 More Democrats or Republicans vote No and it doesn't pass. Nancy Pelosi voted AYE, by the way. NAFTA Vote in the Senate: Democrats 27 YEAs to 28 NAYs, pretty even split Republicans 34 YEAs to 10 NAYs, major majority Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman WTO Vote in the House: Democrats: 167 YEAs to 89 NAYs, 65% voted YEA Republican: 121 YEAs to 56 NAYs, 77% voted YEA Pelosi voted YEA on this too. WTO Vote in Senate: Democrats: 41 YEAs to 14 NAYs, 74.5% voted YEA Republicans: 35 YEAs to 10 NAYs, 77.8% voted YEA Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman As you can see both parties are to blame for NAFTA and the WTO.

content: It looks as though 5 posters are either for the Stimulus or wish it would go further (I_M_Qwerty, crackerjacks861, mrmixitup, Motive25, and Grachus (who doesn't think Clinton and Obama are "real" liberals), while 7 posters are more or less against it (EAG154, scooter_mech, Stec74, Sunliner81, fishnfanatic, godawgz, donniejanuarysr). I'm against the Stimulus. It isn't just that Clinton and Obama aren't "real" liberals, but that they're not really for Jobs, and they're definitely not for BOTH Jobs and Self-Defense. I remind Readers that Bush won in 2000 and 2004 on Self-Defense but not Jobs, while the Dumbocrats and then Obama won in 2006 and 2008 on Jobs but not Self-Defense. That is really Dumb! If an ape made such a decision, we'd probably say that it has half a brain, but apparently politicians are regarded as better for doing the same thing. So how do you get Jobs? Military Jobs come from Republicans mostly (except for Jobs that send you away to Nonstrategic locations where you'll be out of Democrats' hair). Civilian Jobs don't come from either Republicans or Democrats., both of whom give them away to other nations, illegal immigrants, etc. Both parties seem to also manipulate Economic figures before Elections so that when the richest get more money, this is interpreted as "Economic Health" regardless of what everybody else in getting. The Democrats overall ruin the Non-Job-Economy more than the Republicans, though, by Spend-Spend-Spend for Nonstrategic reasons (those who don't want to work, Criminals, abortion, foreign giveaways, plain old Crooks in their pet districts, etc., favorite Ethnic Groups in their pet districts, etc.). Seniors (I'm 70) get shafted by both parties, although older Presidents probably have a little more sympathy for them than younger ones (the 3 youngest Presidents since Teddy Roosevelt were - guess who - Obama, Clinton, and Kennedy). Seniors who believe in Self-Defense probably will get more heart attacks and strokes from Obama, while their Jobs won't improve. They're more or less officially dead insofar as hiring unless by some miracle they've managed to get and stay in some tenured position. Osher Doctorow
reply: It looks as though 5 posters are either for the Stimulus or wish it would go further (I_M_Qwerty, crackerjacks861, mrmixitup, Motive25, and Grachus (who doesn't think Clinton and Obama are "real" liberals), while 7 posters are more or less against it (EAG154, scooter_mech, Stec74, Sunliner81, fishnfanatic, godawgz, donniejanuarysr). I'm against the Stimulus. It isn't just that Clinton and Obama aren't "real" liberals, but that they're not really for Jobs, and they're definitely not for BOTH Jobs and Self-Defense. I remind Readers that Bush won in 2000 and 2004 on Self-Defense but not Jobs, while the Dumbocrats and then Obama won in 2006 and 2008 on Jobs but not Self-Defense. That is really Dumb! If an ape made such a decision, we'd probably say that it has half a brain, but apparently politicians are regarded as better for doing the same thing. So how do you get Jobs? Military Jobs come from Republicans mostly (except for Jobs that send you away to Nonstrategic locations where you'll be out of Democrats' hair). Civilian Jobs don't come from either Republicans or Democrats., both of whom give them away to other nations, illegal immigrants, etc. Both parties seem to also manipulate Economic figures before Elections so that when the richest get more money, this is interpreted as "Economic Health" regardless of what everybody else in getting. The Democrats overall ruin the Non-Job-Economy more than the Republicans, though, by Spend-Spend-Spend for Nonstrategic reasons (those who don't want to work, Criminals, abortion, foreign giveaways, plain old Crooks in their pet districts, etc., favorite Ethnic Groups in their pet districts, etc.). Seniors (I'm 70) get shafted by both parties, although older Presidents probably have a little more sympathy for them than younger ones (the 3 youngest Presidents since Teddy Roosevelt were - guess who - Obama, Clinton, and Kennedy). Seniors who believe in Self-Defense probably will get more heart attacks and strokes from Obama, while their Jobs won't improve. They're more or less officially dead insofar as hiring unless by some miracle they've managed to get and stay in some tenured position. Osher Doctorow

title: Stimulus Works!

content: quote: You are aware that most many of the stimulus provisions don't take effect for a long time, right? As amended, yep! That's one of the (many) reasons the stimulus bill is ... bogus. "Long time" is not the way Obama and Democratic Congress sold the bill. You, of course, are undoubtedly aware that the purpose of the bill was (originally) to create 3.5 million new jobs ... amended (in a CYA move) to preserve and create 3.5 million jobs. I'd suggest that you at least wait until unemployment mirrors what it was on the date that the stimulus bill was passed before bumping this thread.
quote: You are aware that most many of the stimulus provisions don't take effect for a long time, right?
reply: As amended, yep! That's one of the (many) reasons the stimulus bill is ... bogus. "Long time" is not the way Obama and Democratic Congress sold the bill. content: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: If the reps had not pushed the policy of allowing all our jobs to be shipped overseas, we would be in a different position now wouldn't we? Had W not started the BailOut Bananza Boom to start, that can of worms would have never been opened. Thanks "Conservatives"! So when my job at Trek bicycle went to Taiwan I should have blamed the GOP. Thing is that Clinton was president at the time... You're perfectly correct about Clinton and the WTO and NAFTA - But you should also remember that the majority of Democrats voted AGAINST these agreements, and they only passed because almost all Republicans supported them. Now we have Obama as President and he made "noises" about "reforming" Nafta. Which ain't going to happen, because he's not a real Liberal any more than Clinton was. Dave

content: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: If the reps had not pushed the policy of allowing all our jobs to be shipped overseas, we would be in a different position now wouldn't we? Had W not started the BailOut Bananza Boom to start, that can of worms would have never been opened. Thanks "Conservatives"! So when my job at Trek bicycle went to Taiwan I should have blamed the GOP. Thing is that Clinton was president at the time... You're perfectly correct about Clinton and the WTO and NAFTA - But you should also remember that the majority of Democrats voted AGAINST these agreements, and they only passed because almost all Republicans supported them. Now we have Obama as President and he made "noises" about "reforming" Nafta. Which ain't going to happen, because he's not a real Liberal any more than Clinton was. Dave NAFTA Vote in the House of Representatives: Democrats: 102 AYES to 156 NOES Republicans: 132 AYES to 43 NOES Passed 234 to 200. 18 More Democrats or Republicans vote No and it doesn't pass. Nancy Pelosi voted AYE, by the way. NAFTA Vote in the Senate: Democrats 27 YEAs to 28 NAYs, pretty even split Republicans 34 YEAs to 10 NAYs, major majority Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman WTO Vote in the House: Democrats: 167 YEAs to 89 NAYs, 65% voted YEA Republican: 121 YEAs to 56 NAYs, 77% voted YEA Pelosi voted YEA on this too. WTO Vote in Senate: Democrats: 41 YEAs to 14 NAYs, 74.5% voted YEA Republicans: 35 YEAs to 10 NAYs, 77.8% voted YEA Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman As you can see both parties are to blame for NAFTA and the WTO.
quote: Originally posted by Grachus: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: If the reps had not pushed the policy of allowing all our jobs to be shipped overseas, we would be in a different position now wouldn't we? Had W not started the BailOut Bananza Boom to start, that can of worms would have never been opened. Thanks "Conservatives"! So when my job at Trek bicycle went to Taiwan I should have blamed the GOP. Thing is that Clinton was president at the time... You're perfectly correct about Clinton and the WTO and NAFTA - But you should also remember that the majority of Democrats voted AGAINST these agreements, and they only passed because almost all Republicans supported them. Now we have Obama as President and he made "noises" about "reforming" Nafta. Which ain't going to happen, because he's not a real Liberal any more than Clinton was. Dave
reply: NAFTA Vote in the House of Representatives: Democrats: 102 AYES to 156 NOES Republicans: 132 AYES to 43 NOES Passed 234 to 200. 18 More Democrats or Republicans vote No and it doesn't pass. Nancy Pelosi voted AYE, by the way. NAFTA Vote in the Senate: Democrats 27 YEAs to 28 NAYs, pretty even split Republicans 34 YEAs to 10 NAYs, major majority Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman WTO Vote in the House: Democrats: 167 YEAs to 89 NAYs, 65% voted YEA Republican: 121 YEAs to 56 NAYs, 77% voted YEA Pelosi voted YEA on this too. WTO Vote in Senate: Democrats: 41 YEAs to 14 NAYs, 74.5% voted YEA Republicans: 35 YEAs to 10 NAYs, 77.8% voted YEA Democratic YEA votes included Biden, Dodd, Kennedy, Kerry, and Lieberman As you can see both parties are to blame for NAFTA and the WTO.

content: quote: Originally posted by Motive25: quote: Originally posted by I_M_Qwerty: It appears that confidence in the stimulus plan is being reflected in the pink slips ... Most economists will tell you that unemployment is the last indicator to improve as a country emerges from recession. “What makes this recovery plan so important, is not just that it will create or save three-and-a-half million jobs over the next two years…it’s that we’re putting Americans to work doing the work that America needs done…in critical areas that have been neglected for too long,” Barack Obama, February 17th, 2009 at the signing of the Simulus Bill.

content: It looks as though 5 posters are either for the Stimulus or wish it would go further (I_M_Qwerty, crackerjacks861, mrmixitup, Motive25, and Grachus (who doesn't think Clinton and Obama are "real" liberals), while 7 posters are more or less against it (EAG154, scooter_mech, Stec74, Sunliner81, fishnfanatic, godawgz, donniejanuarysr). I'm against the Stimulus. It isn't just that Clinton and Obama aren't "real" liberals, but that they're not really for Jobs, and they're definitely not for BOTH Jobs and Self-Defense. I remind Readers that Bush won in 2000 and 2004 on Self-Defense but not Jobs, while the Dumbocrats and then Obama won in 2006 and 2008 on Jobs but not Self-Defense. That is really Dumb! If an ape made such a decision, we'd probably say that it has half a brain, but apparently politicians are regarded as better for doing the same thing. So how do you get Jobs? Military Jobs come from Republicans mostly (except for Jobs that send you away to Nonstrategic locations where you'll be out of Democrats' hair). Civilian Jobs don't come from either Republicans or Democrats., both of whom give them away to other nations, illegal immigrants, etc. Both parties seem to also manipulate Economic figures before Elections so that when the richest get more money, this is interpreted as "Economic Health" regardless of what everybody else in getting. The Democrats overall ruin the Non-Job-Economy more than the Republicans, though, by Spend-Spend-Spend for Nonstrategic reasons (those who don't want to work, Criminals, abortion, foreign giveaways, plain old Crooks in their pet districts, etc., favorite Ethnic Groups in their pet districts, etc.). Seniors (I'm 70) get shafted by both parties, although older Presidents probably have a little more sympathy for them than younger ones (the 3 youngest Presidents since Teddy Roosevelt were - guess who - Obama, Clinton, and Kennedy). Seniors who believe in Self-Defense probably will get more heart attacks and strokes from Obama, while their Jobs won't improve. They're more or less officially dead insofar as hiring unless by some miracle they've managed to get and stay in some tenured position. Osher Doctorow
